step1.sentence: She ran into her old professor at the bookstore and they talked for nearly an hour.

step2.story: James was walking home from the supermarket when he ran into a childhood friend he had not seen in over fifteen years. They stood on the sidewalk swapping stories until it got dark.

step3.story: On her first day in the new city, Clara wandered into a small art gallery just to escape the rain. She had no plan and knew no one. Inside, she ran into a woman from her hometown who had moved there years earlier. They recognized each other immediately and laughed at the coincidence. That random meeting turned into a friendship that lasted for years.

meaning.realUsageKo: 약속 없이 예상치 못한 장소에서 아는 사람을 만났을 때 씁니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: run(이동하다)과 into(안으로, ~와 충돌하여)가 결합하여 예상치 못하게 마주친다는 의미가 되었습니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 우연의 요소가 핵심입니다. 계획된 만남에는 쓰지 않습니다. bump into와 같은 뜻입니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: I ran into my neighbor at the gym this morning.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 오늘 아침 헬스장에서 이웃을 우연히 만났어요.
